div.p: 1. The general term for food is shí 食 and this includes food as well as drink and can refer generally to one's livelihood, also to staple foods as opposed to delicacies involving meat, such as kuài 膾 "minced meat, raw".
2. Fàn 飯 which refers to basic foodstuff, usually rice and cereals.
3. Shū 疏, sūn 飧, cū 粗 refer to crude foodstuffs, grain-based or vegetable based.
4. Liáng 糧 refers to grain-based ordinary plain food.
5. Hūn 葷 refers to non-vegetarian food.
NB: This group needs to be elaborated.
飯，漢以後可作口語中的飯食通稱。
羞，多滋味美餚，有奇珍異獸、四時水鮮、果脯餌餅等。
FOOD 38. 菹，腌製的鹹菜、酸菜、糟菜。
齏，切細腌漬物；也可腌肉。
醢，醬製法制的醬肉；通稱。
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: Novyj objasnitel'nyj Slovar' Sinonimov Russkogo Jazyka
A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages

note.p: epulae is the general word referring to a meal of any kind.
convivium refers to a social convivial meal.
dapes refers to a religious meal as part of a religious service to the gods.
epulum is a formal dinner party, prototypically in honour of someone, on a large scale, and with the presence of notables.
commissatio refers to a lavish meal involving many courses of delicacies.

bibl.title: 中國上古烹食字典 Zhongguo shanggu pengshi zidian
Encyclopedia of Social and Cultural Anthropology
SYNONYMES FRANÇOIS, LEURS DIFFÉRENTES SIGNIFICATIONS, ET LE CHOIX QU'IL EN FAUT FAIRE Pour parler avec justesse

Bibliographisches Handbuch zur Sprachinhaltsforschung. Teil II. Systematischer Teil. B. Ordnung nach Sinnbezirken (mit einem alphabetischen Begriffsschluessel): Der Mensch und seine Welt im Spiegel der Sprachforschung

sense.def: supplies of food and other necessities of life

entry.def: Shū 疏, sūn 飧, liáng 糧, cū 粗 refer to crude foodstuffs, grain-based or vegetable based.

sense.def: plain, undistinguished food, particularly vegetables[is there any nominal usage ??; usually used as vadN: see COARSE][CA]
dumplings made of rice-flour and honey (CC)
dumplings made of rice flour and honey (CC)

entry.def: Shū 疏, sūn 飧, cū 粗 refer to crude foodstuffs, grain-based or vegetable based.
Shū 疏, sūn 飧, cū 粗 refer to crude foodstuffs, grain-based or vegetable based.

sense.def: not properly threshed grain; crude food; coarse rice
dry provisions; parched wheat or rice
mix rice into (soup) [LIJI: that refers to dumplings or cakes which consist of equal quantities of beef, mutton and pork which are mixed with rice, formed into balls and fried][CA]

entry.def: Liáng 糧 refers to grain-based ordinary plain food.

sense.def: victuals; grain, provisions; food rations for travel; rations

entry.def: Hūn 葷 refers to non-vegetarian food.

The general term for food is shí 食 and this includes food as well as drink and can refer generally to one's livelihood, also to staple foods as opposed to delicacies involving meat, such as kuài 膾 "minced meat, raw".

sense.def: Note that Lù Démíng reads this meaning as sì in several places of 經典釋文: provisions; food supply; staple food; food for general sustenance while at home; (e.g. beg for) something to eat; food supplies; fodder (e.g. for horses)

entry.def: Shū 疏, sūn 飧, liáng 糧, cū 粗 refer to crude foodstuffs, grain-based or vegetable based.

sense.def: food for general sustenance while at home [someimtes referring to the food consumed during the evening meal][CA]
LIJI: add liquid to the rice before and eat it, probably at the end of a meal (see WANGLI: 1661)Rarely also: 'eat a warm meal'GY 08.01.03/287 優施出， 里克辟奠， 不飧而寑〔一〕。 ( 飧 : 熟食曰飧。 )

entry.def: Fàn 飯 which refers to basic foodstuff, usually rice and cereals.

sense.def: cereal; staple foodstuff; grain/rice based foodstuffsgeneral: a meal
SHI: cooked food or food ready for consumption; MENG 6B10: banquet (in the morning?)�
MENG 3A4: make one's own food for breakfast [really for breakfast or prepare food in general??][CA]
exotic food; exotic dishes; outlandish fare
elaborate meal where wine is being served
necessities like food; food an other items of daily use
daily sustenance; daily needs such as food
crushed fried barley or other cereals used as staple food
